#272 - OCCI Infrastructure: Compute instances
entry.content:
(section 3.1 + parts of 3.5.1 & 3.5.2)
We have to clearly state what is required to create a Compute instance. Currently the relationship between attributes (almost all optional right now) and resource templates is vague at best.
A valid instance must contain either
~~
occi.compute.architecture
&
occi.compute.cores
&
occi.compute.memory
~~
or a
~~
resource_tpl
~~

If not, we need to specify that the service provider can choose a default resource_tpl (no additional details).

We need to clarify, an os_tpl is required to create a compute instance. A while ago, we decided that storage links cannot be used as a replacement for os_tpl. If not, we need to specify that an os_tpl or storagelink is included.

entry.title: #272 - OCCI Infrastructure: OS Template -- naming issue
entry.content: Consider re-naming the `os_tpl` (OS Template) mixin. Using OS (Operating System) is misleading, `apl_tpl` (Appliance Template) would be an option. It could be introduced now as an alternative to `os_tpl`, deprecating `os_tpl` and superseding it in future versions.

entry.title: #272 - OCCI Infrastructure: Resource & OS Template Mixin -- Re-assignment/Replacement/Resizing Rules
entry.content:
OCCI infrastructure should clearly define how `resource_tpl` (and related) and `os_tpl` (and related) mixins behave when already assigned to `compute` instances. Especially behavior around mixin replacement and removal needs to be defined explicitly.

This is needed to standardize `compute` instance resizing and run-time OS changes. As this behavior is often implemented and requested by users.

Existing documents (core & infra) imply how this should be handled, however I would recommend stating this explicitly (=> interoperability).

entry.title: #272 - OCCI Infrastructure: Resource Template Mixin -- Attribute Visibility Issue
entry.content:
This section (in 3.5.2) needs changing:

~~
The preset Resource configuration is not visable through the OCCI
Discovery mechanism. The Mixin.attributes (inherited from Category)
is empty for a Resource Template Mixin. The side-effect of initialising
Resource attributes with pre-defined values is handled by
the implementation.
~~

As now we have a mechanism to advertise mixin attributes (incl. default values) through the JSON rendering.
